    rcwChart

    2018-01-07

    Limitations

    • web-components/blob/dev/lib/rcw-charts/docs/limitations.md

    • tooltip: if multiple charts are rendered in the same page, only the first one will have his tooltip display correctly

    Bar Chart

    rcwChart(rcw_sym2, type = "bar")

    Data

    ## knitr::kable(rcw_rand)
knitr::kable(rcw_sym2)
    x y highlightIndex baselineIndex
    Hungary 5.50 -1 -1
    Sweden 5.60 -1 -1
    Estonia 5.70 -1 -1
    Finland 5.80 -1 -1
    Belgium 5.90 -1 -1
    Turkey 6.00 -1 -1
    France 6.50 -1 -1
    Poland 6.60 -1 -1
    Slovenia 6.80 -1 -1
    European Union 7.40 -1 0
    Euro area (18 countries) 8.20 -1 -1
    Ireland 8.70 0 -1
    Italy 8.90 -1 -1
    Slovak Republic 9.90 -1 -1
    Portugal 10.90 -1 -1
    South Africa 12.30 1 -1
    Spain (2 digits) 16.86 -1 -1

    Row Chart

    rowData <- rcw_rand
rowData <- subset(rcw_rand, select = c("y", "x", "highlightIndex", "baselineIndex"))
names(rowData) <- c("x", "y", "highlightIndex", "baselineIndex")
rcwChart(rowData, type = "row")

    Data

    • RowChart requires a numeric vector at x and a character vector at y 
    knitr::kable(head(rcw_rand, 10))
    x y highlightIndex baselineIndex
    lalala hello things end 51 -1 -1
    label2 1 -1 -1
    label3 19 -1 -1
    label4 76 -1 0
    label5 76 -1 -1
    label6 16 -1 -1
    label7 35 -1 -1
    label8 15 0 -1
    label9 -17 -1 -1
    label10 85 -1 -1

    Scatter Chart

    scatterData <- rcw_rand
scatterData$x <- scatterData$y * sample(seq(0, 1, 0.01), nrow(scatterData))
    ## Warning in sample.int(length(x), size, replace, prob): '.Random.seed' is
## not an integer vector but of type 'NULL', so ignored
    rcwChart(scatterData, type = "scatter")

    Data

    • ScatterChart requires numeric vectors both at x and y 
    ## # A tibble: 30 x 4
##         x     y highlightIndex baselineIndex
##     <dbl> <dbl>          <int>         <int>
##  1  46.41    51             -1            -1
##  2   0.38     1             -1            -1
##  3  17.10    19             -1            -1
##  4  60.80    76             -1             0
##  5  63.84    76             -1            -1
##  6   1.44    16             -1            -1
##  7   6.65    35             -1            -1
##  8   9.60    15              0            -1
##  9 -16.32   -17             -1            -1
## 10  64.60    85             -1            -1
## # ... with 20 more rows
